name: Music Player
description: I created this music player inspired by Apple Music's interface. I used the audio API and Rabbit Lyrics synchronizer's CDN to make the lyrics appear dynamically while the song is being played. Try it out, it's a good song!

name: Quiz App
description: For this project I used HTML, CSS and JavaScript. I also fetched the trivia questions from the Open Trivia DB API and used Local Storage to keep track of the scores.

name: Memory Cards
description: This project is a React adaptation of one of Brad Traversy's 20 vanilla JavaScript projects. I added some new features to this version such as being able to delete each card instad of just deleting all of them at once. Local Storage is used to save the created cards.

name: Pok√©mon Game
description: This was my first project focused on Vanilla JavaScript. It's based on the logic of the Rock, Papers, Scissors game. I really enjoyed creating this one since it was mostly a fun activity to get more familiar with the language.

name: Testih
description: I created this app by the end of 2019. I thought it was a good idea for people to have an app that would show them health centres where they could go and take the HIV test in Santiago for free. It also shows the centres where the PrEP pill is given. For this one, I used Ruby on Rails, Bootstrap, the Google maps API, the Facebook Login API and PostgreSQL for the data base.
tools: Ruby on Rails, Google Maps API, Facebook Login API

name: Meal Finder
description: This project uses HTML,CSS and JavaScript. In this small project the MealDB API was used to fetch the meals searched by the user.

name: Barbershop
description: In this simple landing page I used Bootstrap with Sass, following BEM methodology. It was mainly a means to practice this convention.

name: iTech
description: This was a project created with Bootstrap as part of a test for one of my courses. This was mainly to practice and get familiar with Bootstrap components.
